text:
e="preserve">A native speaker is someone who learned to speak a language as part of his or her childhood development. A native speaker's language is usually the language their parents speak and/or the language of their country of origin. It is the only language of a monolingual person, and likely the first language of a multilingual person which is acquired naturally in their native environment. It may serve as the basis for their sociolinguistic identity.
Many people who hire language teachers prefer native speakers.
